public boolean isConnected(org.apache.http.client.methods.HttpPost post)
This will check the connection to the json server.

Parameters:
post - HttpPost object. This will allow the to specify their own url.
Returns:
true if connected, false otherwise

isConnected

public boolean isConnected()
Same functionality as the other method but uses the default httpPost.

Returns:

getLatestTask

public Task getLatestTask()
This will get the latest task added. This will use ?action=list&n=1 to only get the latest task. Currently this is mainly used for cleanup in the JUnit tests but the functionality may be extended in the future.

Returns:
the latest task or null if there is no value

addTask

public JSONServer.Code addTask(Task task)
This will add the task in JSON format to the server using Gson. The task will first use a post action to send the data to the server. It will then take that response from the server to obtain the id for the task and assign it to our Task object. An update method is then called on the task after we update it with the obtained id.

Parameters:
task - The task to add to the server
Returns:
Code.SUCCESS or Code.FAILURE

getAllTasks

public java.util.ArrayList<Task> getAllTasks()
This will retrieve all tasks by using Gson to retrieve the ids of each task from the server. The results will be stored in a ServerData object and the ids will be added to an array. After retrieving all the ids, we use the internal getTask(String id) method to get the task and add it to the tasks array

Returns:
An ArrayList. The list will be empty if there are no tasks

sync

public JSONServer.Code sync()
Name: This syncs our local tasks to the most recent server version

Returns:

addSubmission

public JSONServer.Code addSubmission(java.lang.String taskId,
                                     Submission submission)
This adds a submission to an existing task

Parameters:
taskId - The id of the task
submission - The Submission object
Returns:
Code.FAILURE or Code.SUCCESS

deleteTask

public JSONServer.Code deleteTask(Task task)
This will remove the task from the server given a specified task id.

Parameters:
taskId - the id of the task to be removed
Returns:
Code.SUCCESS or Code.FAILURE

updateTask

public JSONServer.Code updateTask(java.lang.String id,
                                  Task task)
This will update a task with a new task and replace it on the server

Parameters:
taskId - The id of the task
task - The Task object to replace the current one
Returns:
Code.FAILURE or Code.SUCCESS
